nodes.title: Transfers from Binance and Coinbase now available in MetaMask Portfolio
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask's new CEX transfer feature simplifies asset transfers between centralized exchanges, enhancing both security and user experience.

image.title: Transfers from Binance and Coinbase now available in MetaMask Portfolio feature image

childMarkdownRemark.html:
In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency, the ability to manage assets efficiently across various platforms is crucial. Recognizing this need, MetaMask is thrilled to introduce a new feature within the MetaMask Portfolio to significantly streamline the process of transferring assets between centralized exchange (CEX) platforms like Coinbase and Binance and MetaMask.

For many users, the digital asset landscape is scattered across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. The challenge of moving assets from one platform to another has often been a cumbersome process, fraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly and exposing oneself to potential security vulnerabilities.

MetaMask's latest update aims to address this issue head-on, offering a solution that not only enhances user experience but also bolsters security.

Instant transfer of assets from exchanges to into your MetaMask wallet

With the new integration, users can now effortlessly link their Coinbase or Binance accounts to their MetaMask wallet directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. MetaMask will never have access to exchange login credentials nor share any MetaMask wallet addresses with any third parties. Check out the below tutorial to see how it easy it is to connect to an exchange and transfer funds:

This seamless connection allows for the instant transfer of assets between accounts, eliminating the need for the manual entry of addresses. Additionally, for those with bank accounts linked to their Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly into their MetaMask wallet has never been easier. Here's what's new:

  • Direct Integration: This feature enables users to transfer assets between their Coinbase or Binance accounts and MetaMask with just a few clicks, bypassing the cumbersome process of copying and pasting addresses.

  • Fiat to Crypto Onramp: Users can now directly convert fiat to crypto in their MetaMask account through their linked bank account on CEXs, streamlining the process of adding funds to their wallets.

It's important to note that, initially, this feature will support transfers from Coinbase or Binance accounts only, with plans to expand to other exchanges soon. No fees will be charged when transferring assets from exchanges to MetaMask, but a nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges, ensuring the sustainability of this valuable service. Network gas fees also apply.

Improving web3 UX with MetaMask step-by-step

This update is a step forward in MetaMask's mission to simplify the crypto experience, making it more accessible and secure for users worldwide. By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is not just solving the fragmentation issue within the ecosystem but also paving the way for a more integrated and user-friendly digital asset environment.

nodes.metaTitle: Transfers from CEX now available in MetaMask Portfolio
nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask's new CEX transfer feature simplifies asset transfers between centralized exchanges, enhancing both security and user experience.

nodes.title: More With MetaMask: Mendi Finance Snap
nodes.subtitle: The More With MetaMask Partner Series explores builders who are transforming web3.

image.title: More With MetaMask: Mendi Finance
image.description: More With MetaMask Partner Series: Mendi Finance

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask is the gateway to the decentralized web, enabling you to do more. Users can connect to any dapp, on any network, from any device. From DeFi to DeSci, gaming to NFTs, and beyond: MetaMask is deeply passionate about the web3 community. The More With MetaMask Partner Series spotlights the builders who are innovating across web3. First up, Mendi Financeâ€”creator of a MetaMask Snap that MetaMask users can add directly to their wallet for increased functionality.

Since the birth of DeFi, lending and borrowing have played pivotal roles in guaranteeing maximum capital efficiency, allowing users to HODL their assets while participating in DeFi to earn yields. However, lending and borrowing also come with risks. Amongst these is the threat of liquidation due to a lack of funds.

Usersâ€™ funds can be liquidated if their collateral is no longer sufficient to cover their loan. In the last 30 days, over $27 million was liquidated from the top 3 lending protocols alone. MetaMask has teamed up with Mendi Finance to empower users to avoid liquidation, and efficiently keep track of their financial limits.

Together, MetaMask and Mendi have created the first DeFi Snap on Lineaâ€”the Mendi Finance Liquidation alertâ€”allowing users to lend and borrow with peace of mind. Users can manually set a borrow limit that they consider unhealthy. Once crossed, a typical Metamask notification will inform them about the nearing liquidation threshold.

By implementing a feature that should become the new standard for on-chain lending, users are given a more granular level of security in their DeFi journey.

Ready to take control of your DeFi experience? Add Mendi Finance Liquidation alert to your MetaMask Snaps to safeguard your assets and maximize your financial potential.

nodes.metaDescription: The More With MetaMask Partner Series spotlights builders who are innovating across web3. First up, Mendi Finance.

nodes.title: MetaMaskâ€™s Commitment to Data Privacy
nodes.subtitle: Discover how MetaMask champions data privacy in web3. Learn about customizable settings, secure transactions, and user consent features to protect your digital identity.

image.title: MetaMask's Committment to Data Privacy
image.description: MetaMask's Commitment to Data Privacy graphic

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Data is power. The collection of data traces back millennia to the first writing instruments. Record keeping tools were primitiveâ€”a stone, bone, or reed, and functionalâ€”tabulating supplies, crops, or transactions. In the centuries since, data collection has undergone exponential evolution from crude manual methods to innovative digital techniques, particularly over the last 40 years. The advent of the internet has allowed for information to be instantaneously transmitted globally. Today, our data is owned and exploited by siloed, monolithic organizations to exert control.

Web1: â€œThe Static Iterationâ€ or Read Era

The internet didnâ€™t start out this way. Web1 existed from the early 1990s to the early 2000s. Built with open-source code and a permissionless network, it enabled users to access stored information on static websites and read the content. Data collection was limited. Sensitive personal information largely remained offline. Interconnectivity was prized.

Web2: â€œThe Social Webâ€ or Read Write Era

Web2 has existed from the early 2000s through the 2020s, enabling users to access and interact with websites, mobile apps, and social media networks. As they do, each individual paints a uniquely detailed, digital data portrait of themselves, while adding to User Generated Content (UGC) that informs larger demographic patterns. UGC from over 5 billion people online is held in centralized, closed-off systems, owned entirely by corporations.

Rather than handling users' information privately or even with care, tech behemoths have done the polar opposite. Entities like Facebook, Google, and Amazon are driven by the mass-scale collection and surveillance of data. Highly nuanced personal information about each user is then monetized by advertisers, in order to target people with specific characteristics and behaviors. So, what is the alternative? Cover yourself in aluminum foil, decamp to a remote cave, and communicate solely via carrier pigeon? Not quite.

Web3: â€œThe Decentralized Webâ€ or Read Write Own Era

Web3 began to develop in the 2010s, and enables a much needed paradigm shift, one where data privacy and data ownership are paramount. By design, its technology processes information differently. Data is stored on a decentralized, distributed ledger via open-source, immutable, cryptographic codeâ€”reducing the risk of data abuse and attack. Within a ledger, data is compiled into blocks that are linked together in chronological order, forming a chain. This is why the technology is called blockchain. No single entity can gain monopolistic control. Rather than relying on a centralized server or platform, it is a transparent, peer-to-peer network. This allows users to maintain ownership of their data, because there is no third-party owning user data for surveillance or monetization purposes.

MetaMask: Championing Data Protection in Web3

To connect with blockchains, users must create a wallet address, consisting of an identifying alphanumeric string. This address is the only information needed to access permissionless, decentralized apps (dapps), allowing users to operate pseudo-anonymously if they wish to do so. With their wallet address, users can interact with the decentralized web. Being the gateway to web3 is a position of great responsibility. MetaMask, the worldâ€™s leading self-custodial crypto wallet operating on the Ethereum blockchain, is committed to data protection, user consent, and individual control. Letâ€™s dive into how MetaMask achieves this in more detail.

Key Features of MetaMaskâ€™s Commitment to Data Privacy

Whether you are a crypto newbie or a seasoned degen, MetaMask ensures you have full control over your self-custodial wallet. Our Privacy Best Practices guide gives you an overview of important facets to keep in mind while navigating Web3. MetaMask supports users to make their own decisions regarding privacy as they see fit, via the integration of: customizable settings for privacy, and a tailored user experience; minimization of data sharing, with local device storage; encryption for secure transactions; transparency of processes and data collection methods.

MetaMaskâ€™s Privacy Preserving Features can be adjusted as desired and include:

â— Basic Settings such as gas estimates, token details, and malicious site warnings, can be tailored to user preferences

â— RPC configuration can be changed from default to personal RPC endpoints

â— MetaMask Security Alerts simulating transactions and alerts users before interacting with potentially malicious dapps and smart contracts, can be disabled or enabled

â— Phishing Detection alerting users if a site is identified as potentially malicious using a publicly curated list of sites, can be enabled or disabled

â— Network Detail Checks performing a security check by comparing the name, symbol, RPC URL, and other network details with those on a publicly maintained list when a network is manually added, can be enabled or disabled

â— MetaMetrics analytics designed to help improve MetaMask's user experience with non-sensitive product data, can be disabled or enabled

â— Customizable Smart Transactions improving and optimizing transactions, can be disabled or enabled

â— Auto-Detect Tokens utilizing a carefully curated list of data sources to identity tokens, can be disabled or enabled

â— NFT Media Display requiring retrieval of NFT file images form third-party services, can be disabled or enabled

â— Proposed Nicknames elevating your wallet UX with human-readable moniker suggestions, can be disabled or enabled

Empowering MetaMask Users With More Privacy and Consent

MetaMask is committed to a consent-based approach to privacy. Our privacy notice update provides increased transparency on our data processing activities, and we:

â— Do not collect your private keys.

â— Do not sell your personal information.

â— Do not collect or retain personal information unless necessary to provide you with services and user experience.

â— Do not collect financial payment or banking information. However, when you use on-ramp or off-ramp features these services may necessitate you submitting this information to third-party providers.

Web3 is transforming data privacy and data ownership. With MetaMask, you have authority over your digital identity, and the way your information is shared. Data is power, and MetaMask puts that power back into the hands of the people.

Head over to MetaMask Portfolio now to configure your privacy settings, and take control of your digital identity.

nodes.metaDescription: Discover how MetaMask champions data privacy in web3, via customizable settings, secure transactions, and user consent features to protect digital identity.
